trans-unit.source: Technical reference: conditional access to Azure AD apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Technical reference: conditional access to Azure AD apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: With Conditional access control, Azure Active Directory checks the specific conditions you pick when authenticating the user and before allowing access to the application.
trans-unit.target: With Conditional access control, Azure Active Directory checks the specific conditions you pick when authenticating the user and before allowing access to the application.

trans-unit.source: Once those conditions are met, the user is authenticated and allowed access to the application.
trans-unit.target: Once those conditions are met, the user is authenticated and allowed access to the application.

trans-unit.source: Technical reference: conditional access to Azure AD apps
trans-unit.target: Technical reference: conditional access to Azure AD apps

trans-unit.source: Services enabled with conditional access
trans-unit.target: Services enabled with conditional access

trans-unit.source: Conditional Access rules are supported across various Azure AD application types.
trans-unit.target: Conditional Access rules are supported across various Azure AD application types.

trans-unit.source: This list includes:
trans-unit.target: This list includes:

trans-unit.source: Federated applications from the Azure AD application gallery
trans-unit.target: Federated applications from the Azure AD application gallery

trans-unit.source: Password SSO applications from the Azure AD application gallery
trans-unit.target: Password SSO applications from the Azure AD application gallery

trans-unit.source: Applications registered with the Azure Application Proxy
trans-unit.target: Applications registered with the Azure Application Proxy

trans-unit.source: Developed line of business and multi-tenant applications registered with Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Developed line of business and multi-tenant applications registered with Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Online
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Online

trans-unit.source: Azure Remote App
trans-unit.target: Azure Remote App

trans-unit.source: Enable access rules
trans-unit.target: Enable access rules

trans-unit.source: Each rule can be enabled or disabled on a per application bases.
trans-unit.target: Each rule can be enabled or disabled on a per application bases.

trans-unit.source: When rules are **ON** they will be enabled and enforced for users accessing the application.
trans-unit.target: When rules are **ON** they will be enabled and enforced for users accessing the application.

trans-unit.source: When they are **OFF** they will not be used and will not impact the users sign in experience.
trans-unit.target: When they are **OFF** they will not be used and will not impact the users sign in experience.

trans-unit.source: Applying rules to specific users
trans-unit.target: Applying rules to specific users

trans-unit.source: Rules can be applied to specific sets of users based on security group by setting **Apply To**.
trans-unit.target: Rules can be applied to specific sets of users based on security group by setting **Apply To**.

trans-unit.source: **Apply To** can be set to **All Users** or **Groups**.
trans-unit.target: **Apply To** can be set to **All Users** or **Groups**.

trans-unit.source: When set to **All Users** the rules will apply to any user with access to the application.
trans-unit.target: When set to **All Users** the rules will apply to any user with access to the application.

trans-unit.source: The **Groups** option allows specific security and distribution groups to be selected, rules will only be enforced for these groups.
trans-unit.target: The **Groups** option allows specific security and distribution groups to be selected, rules will only be enforced for these groups.

trans-unit.source: When deploying a rule it is common to first apply it a limited set of users, that are members of a piloting groups.
trans-unit.target: When deploying a rule it is common to first apply it a limited set of users, that are members of a piloting groups.

trans-unit.source: Once complete the rule can be applied to **All Users**.
trans-unit.target: Once complete the rule can be applied to **All Users**.

trans-unit.source: This will cause the rule to be enforced for all users in the organization.
trans-unit.target: This will cause the rule to be enforced for all users in the organization.

trans-unit.source: Select groups may also be exempted from policy using the **Except** option.
trans-unit.target: Select groups may also be exempted from policy using the **Except** option.

trans-unit.source: Any members of these groups will be exempted even if they appear in an included group.
trans-unit.target: Any members of these groups will be exempted even if they appear in an included group.

trans-unit.source: “At work” networks
trans-unit.target: “At work” networks

trans-unit.source: Conditional access rules that use an “At work” network, rely on trusted IP ranges that have been configured in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access rules that use an “At work” network, rely on trusted IP ranges that have been configured in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: These rules include:
trans-unit.target: These rules include:

trans-unit.source: Require multi-factor authentication when not at work
trans-unit.target: Require multi-factor authentication when not at work

trans-unit.source: Block access when not at work
trans-unit.target: Block access when not at work

trans-unit.source: Trusted IP ranges can be configured in the [multi-factor authentication configuration page](../multi-factor-authentication/multi-factor-authentication-whats-next.md).
trans-unit.target: Trusted IP ranges can be configured in the [multi-factor authentication configuration page](../multi-factor-authentication/multi-factor-authentication-whats-next.md).

trans-unit.source: Conditional Access policy will use the configured ranges on each authentication request and token issuance to evaluate rules.
trans-unit.target: Conditional Access policy will use the configured ranges on each authentication request and token issuance to evaluate rules.

trans-unit.source: The inside corpnet claim is not used since it is not available for longer lived sessions, such as refresh tokens in mobile applications.
trans-unit.target: The inside corpnet claim is not used since it is not available for longer lived sessions, such as refresh tokens in mobile applications.

trans-unit.source: Per-application rules
trans-unit.target: Per-application rules

trans-unit.source: Rules are configured per application allowing the high value services to be secured without impacting access to other services.
trans-unit.target: Rules are configured per application allowing the high value services to be secured without impacting access to other services.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access rules can be configured on the **Configure** tab of the application.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access rules can be configured on the **Configure** tab of the application.

trans-unit.source: Rules currently offered:
trans-unit.target: Rules currently offered:

trans-unit.source: Require multi-factor authentication
trans-unit.target: Require multi-factor authentication

trans-unit.source: All users that this policy is applied to will be required to authenticate via multi-factor authentication at least once.
trans-unit.target: All users that this policy is applied to will be required to authenticate via multi-factor authentication at least once.

trans-unit.source: Require multi-factor authentication when not at work
trans-unit.target: Require multi-factor authentication when not at work

trans-unit.source: If this policy is applied, all users will be required to have performed multi-factor authentication at least once if they access the service from a non-work remote location.
trans-unit.target: If this policy is applied, all users will be required to have performed multi-factor authentication at least once if they access the service from a non-work remote location.

trans-unit.source: If they move from a work to remote location, they will be required to perform multifactor authentication when accessing the service.
trans-unit.target: If they move from a work to remote location, they will be required to perform multifactor authentication when accessing the service.

trans-unit.source: Block access when not at work
trans-unit.target: Block access when not at work

trans-unit.source: When users move from work to a remote location, they will be blocked if the "Block access when not at work" policy is applied to them.
trans-unit.target: When users move from work to a remote location, they will be blocked if the "Block access when not at work" policy is applied to them.

trans-unit.source: They will be re-allowed access when at a work location.
trans-unit.target: They will be re-allowed access when at a work location.

trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Securing access to Office 365 and other apps connected to Azure Active Directory
